result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Omarion R McNealy in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Omarion R McNealy.  Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Motion to Withdraw Hearing. Defense counsel withdraws motion. Defense has received discovery and an offer and requests matter be set for final pretrial and jury trial. All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing. All motions to be filed within 45 days.  Court will set a hearing for an evidentiary hearing. Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Motion hearing scheduled for January 13, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Final pre-trial scheduled for January 27, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Jury trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 08:15 am.
Defense unavailable at 8:15 AM and request matter be set for Thursday October 27, 2022 at 1:15 PM.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD. The Court is in trial on another matter. Parties informed of new court date. Case adjourned, Branch 38.
Motion hearing scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:15 am.
AFFIDAVIT SUPPORTING MOTION, filed.
filed.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Omarion R McNealy. Defendant Omarion R McNealy not in court, in custody.    Attorney Paul Leonard Tiffin in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and request additional hearing to review all materials.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Omarion R McNealy in court with attorney Frederick F Klimetz.  Defendant Omarion R McNealy in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Arraignment. Defendant previouslu entered a not guilty plea. Defense in receipt of discovery materials and request additional hearing. This case is not joinable and the state does not intend on joining cases. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Arraignment on August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Case assigned to Judge Brostrom, Branch 06 in error. Case has been reassigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner.

Defendant Omarion R McNealy in court by video with Attorney Frederick F Klimetz who appears in person.  Defendant Omarion R McNealy in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 15, Judge J.D. Watts. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed. Defense given an arraignment date.
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04E (Amended), parties are hereby advised: Effective July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen R. Brostrom, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court via zoom, defendant Omarion R McNealy not in court, in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status of Counsel hearing. Defendant not produced. Attorney Klimetz informs court that he was recently appointed and  requests a Preliminary Hearing date. Court grants request, and adjourns matter to Prelim court.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Omarion R McNealy in court with Attorney Thomas Holland Reed.  Defendant Omarion R McNealy in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Statements to the Court by defense counsel as to attempts to appoint counsel.

As there are 2 co-defendants, Court will allow additional time for Public Defender to appoint counsel.
Court orders case adjourned for CAUSE and adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 15.

Clerk:  jms
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Omarion R McNealy not in court, defendant in custody.  Paul Leonard Tiffin appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case retabbed to Branch 15. Judge Watts due to Co Defendant. Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court. Date provided by Br.15 Clerk. Hearing scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered no contact with Daylin Bridges and Rashaun Seaberry.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Omarion R McNealy in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Omarion R McNealy in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has NOT been obtained from the Defendant.  Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department to obtain DNA sample from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
  All parties are notified that effective June 13, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Mark Sanders, Branch 28, in Room 620 of the Safety Building.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
